intro: Ayenia aliculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ayenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Ayenia aliculata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
